definition: can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
permanent/constant/fixed/usual/ordinary/rule (old)/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷟)

sentences.english: Is conservation of energy one of those misguided ideas?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，“能量守恆”會是這類誤導我們的觀念之一嗎？

sentences.english: Now he will demonstrate the conservation of energy.
sentences.chinese: 現在他要演示能量守恆定理。

sentences.english: Invariance under translation in time leads to conservation of energy.
sentences.chinese: 在時間平移下的不變性導致能量守恆。

definition: interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
conservation (e.g. of energy, momentum or heat in physics)/to remain constant (of a number)
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict

pinyin: li4 shi3 wei2 wu4 zhu3 yi4
